issue.title: Allow stubs to use newer syntax than 3.7
issue.body:
Fixes #13499

Today this code reads like "stubs should all target 3.7" and this
is indeed how typeshed operates. But authors of pyi other than typeshed
should probably be allowed to choose what Python version they're
targetting. Since typeshed runs checks against 3.7, this should not
cause testing regressions for typeshed.

This code goes back to #3000 back in the typed_ast days, when this
allowed stubs to use much newer syntax features than the base Python
version, so in some ways this is in the spirit of the original code.

body: Thanks for the quick response and fix :-)

issue.title: Mypy in 3.10 does not respect the python version when checking .pyi files
issue.body:
Mypy installed in a python 3.10 docker container fails to parse a `.pyi` file with the following error:

```
usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/numpy/__init__.pyi:636: error: Positional-only parameters are only supported in Python 3.8 and greater
Found 1 error in 1 file (errors prevented further checking)
```

**To Reproduce**

1. `docker run -it --rm python:3.10 bash`
2. `pip install numpy mypy`
3. Create a test.py with:
```
import numpy
```
4. Run `mypy test.py`

**Expected Behavior**

I expect mypy to be able to parse this `.pyi` file successfully given that it is being run from a python 3.10 interpreter. The error fails because it attempts to parse it with an incompatible version that does not have positional-only parameters.

I am also unable to squash this error because it seems to happen at a stage where errors can't be silenced.

**Actual Behavior**

The above error occurs. I have tested that this error does not occur in python 3.9. It occurs across multiple operating systems including MacOS and Linux, across both amd64 and arm64 architectures, across multiple versions of mypy, and multiple versions of numpy

**Your Environment**

- Mypy version used: 0.971
- Mypy command-line flags: None
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files): None
- Python version used: 3.10
- Operating system and version: MacOS

issue.title: Mypy (running in 3.10) complains that positional-only parameters are only supported in 3.8+
issue.body:
**Bug Report**

**To Reproduce**

reporting based on current project, will try and find time for a minimal repro later, but in short:
* a python3.10 virtualenv with mypy and numpy (specific versions below)
* start mypy


**Actual Behavior**

```
ðŸ‘‰  mypy /path/to/my_file.py
.venv/lib/python3.10/site-packages/numpy/__init__.pyi:642: error: Positional-only parameters are only supported in Python 3.8 and greater
Found 1 error in 1 file (errors prevented further checking)
```

I did also try adding an explict ` --python-version 3.10` flag, same result.

**Your Environment**

debian

- Mypy version used: mypy 0.971 (compiled: yes)
- Mypy command-line flags: (none)
- Mypy configuration options from `mypy.ini` (and other config files):

```
[tool.mypy]

[[tool.mypy.overrides]]
module = [
    "trimesh",
    "gmsh",
    "pyembree.*",
    "scipy.*",  # TODO: surely there are stubs for scipy somewhere?
]
ignore_missing_imports = true
```

- Python version used: Python 3.10.7
- Operating system and version: Debian bullseye
- numpy version 1.22.3

issue.title: Positional-only parameters are only supported in Python 3.8 and greater
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
I have a project running `mypy` on **panda-stubs**.

**To Reproduce**
See https://gitlab.com/biomedit/sett/-/jobs/3016695046:
```bash
$ mypy
/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pandas-stubs/_config/config.pyi:28: error: Positional-only parameters are only supported in Python 3.8 and greater
Found 1 error in 1 file (errors prevented further checking)
```

**Please complete the following information:**
 - OS: macOS
 - OS Version:  12.6
 - python version: 3.10.7
 - version of type checker: **mypy** _v0.971_
 - version of installed `pandas-stubs`: 1.4.4.220912

issue.title: Fix build
issue.body:
[Failing for python 3.10](https://github.com/pennsignals/dsdk/runs/8261005833?check_suite_focus=true)

Shortly we will be able to remove the 3.7, and 3.8 builds.

It looks like numpy may have updated. This nightly build is desirable for exactly this sort of discovery.

repository.name: circuitpython
repository.description: CircuitPython - a Python implementation for teaching coding with microcontrollers

issue.body:
Over in #6944 we temporarily worked around https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/13499 by using an older Python.

Remove this workaround once mypy has released their fix: https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/13385

repository.name: pystan
repository.description: PyStan, a Python interface to Stan, a platform for statistical modeling. Documentation: https://pystan.readthedocs.io

issue.title: Drop support for Python 3.7

repository.name: pydpf-composites
repository.description: A Python wrapper for Ansys DPF for the post-processing of composite structures.

issue.body:
Drop support for Python 3.7, and remove it from the tox and CI/CD configurations.

Upgrade mypy to avoid https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/13499, and add checks for 'None' to account for newly reported errors.

issue.title: test: make the pytest option testcase require cmd
issue.body: It fails if the command doesn't exist, since the options are parsed from the command invocation.

issue.title: Configure mypy skip following imports for some dependencies to workaround bugs

repository.name: ofrak
repository.description: OFRAK: unpack, modify, and repack binaries.

issue.body:
Authored by @Jepson2k

Workaround for issues such as  https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/13499
in the version of mypy version we're currently using which are causing
spurious type checking failures.

These workarounds should be removed when we bump the mypy version to
one without these bugs.

- [x] I have reviewed the [OFRAK contributor guide](https://ofrak.com/docs/contributor-guide/getting-started.html) and attest that this pull request is in accordance with it.

**One sentence summary of this PR (This should go in the CHANGELOG!)**
Configure mypy skip following imports for some dependencies to workaround bugs.

**Link to Related Issue(s)**
#550 

**Please describe the changes in your request.**
Add `follow_imports = skip` to `tempfile312`, `lief` and `numpy` to workaround mypy bugs causing spurious type checking failures.

**Anyone you think should look at this, specifically?**
